intro: Rindera tschotkalensis var. aculeata, commonly known as the spiny rindera, is a member of the Apiaceae family and is native to southern Africa. This plant is characterized by its distinctive, hairy, and often spiny stems and leaves, which provide it with a rugged appearance. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, a typical feature of the carrot family. The plant thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It is often found in open grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
